newsitem.title: ITALY: Two Italy brokers win appeals over suspension.
newsitem.headline: Two Italy brokers win appeals over suspension.

text.p: Italian brokerage houses Roma Sim, owned by Banca di Roma, and Coen Campos Venuti & Co Sim have won appeals to the State Council overturning their suspension by bourse watchdog Consob, market sources said.
Consob suspended the two brokers at the end of August, for two and four months respectively, for a series of irregularities.

The Lazio regional court rejected their appeals earlier this month but the brokers took their case to the State Council, Italy's highest body overseeing administrative justice, which the brokers said had upheld their case and overturned the original suspensions.
